page.title: 19RECREATION
page.content: Sport includes local football team, fishing, shooting and occasional visit by Fox Hunt. One private Tennis Court. Indoor sports, Squash, Swimming &c at Mkt.Rasen and Louth Sports Centres. Golf st Mkt.Rasen where there is also Steeplechasing. Some Horse riding. Most people have gardens and freeze produce. Wine & Beer making and usual hobbies _Knitting, Embroidery,Tapestry Rug Making, Photography &c.Most Public Footpaths under the Plough but one major path, the Viking Way is well used, running from the Humber to Oakham, Rutland. The Ramblers' Assoc_ _iation walked it in 1985 as part of their Golden Jubilee celebration. Women's Institute, Founded 1947, meets monthly in School enjoying Speakers & Demonstrations on various subjects and support charitable nd other worthwhile organisations. Approx: 15 Members.
